statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

header.gameNote: HORIZON LEAGUE TOURNAMENT AT WRIGHT STATE

article.headline: Loyola of Chicago 66, Illinois-Chicago 62
article.story: DAYTON, Ohio (AP) -- Blake Schilb scored 31 points to lead Loyola of Chicago to a 66-62 win over Illinois-Chicago in the second round of the Horizon League conference tournament. Schilb went 12-of-17 from the field and 5-of-6 from the foul line. He also grabbed eight rebounds. Othyus Jeffers scored 14 points to lead UIC. Josh Mayo added 13 points, and Jovan Stefanov chipped in 12. Loyola (21-10) shot 50 percent from the field in the first half to take a 39-34 lead into the locker room. The teams struggled after halftime, both shooting less than 39 percent during the final 20 minutes. After the Flames (14-18) cut a 10-point deficit to five with 8:49 remaining, Loyola responded with a 7-0 run, capped by Schilb's 3-pointer with 6:14 left. UIC would rally one final time, and a layup by Jeffers cut the deficit to two with 49 seconds to go. But Schilb once again answered with a jumper with 10 seconds left. Jeffers fouled him on the shot, and Schilb made the ensuing free throw to extend the lead to five and seal the outcome. Andy Polka snared 12 rebounds for Loyola, which outrebounded UIC 40-26 for the game. Loyola will play Horizon League No. 2 seed and 18th-ranked Butler (26-5) in Saturday's semifinal round.
